To add Business Defined Content Type and related metadata:

Add a new Business Defined Content Type:

  • Access the Documents and Media portlet.
  • From the Documents and Media screen select "Manage" then "Document Types".
  • From the Document Types screen press the "Add" button.
  • From the "New Document Type" screen give your content type a name and optionally a description.

Add the main metadata for the Business Defined Content Type:

  • In the "Main Metadata Fields" section, drag and drop form fields from the palette on the left to the canvas on the right.
  • Double click on the first field on the canvas on the right side of the screen.
  • Review all of the field properties in the "Settings" tab on the left side of the screen.
  • Double click the "Field Label" setting, and enter the text you would like to use as a label for the field.
  • Continue setting the field labels for the remaining form fields.

Associate any additional metadata for the Business Defined Content Type:

  • In the "Additional Metadata Fields" section select "Select Metadata Set".
  • From the "Metadata Sets" screen press the "Add" button.
  • From the "New Metadata Sets" screen define the Metadata Set Fields the same way as previously done for the "Main Metadata Fields".
  • On the "New Metadata Sets" screen press the "Save" button to save the Metadata Set.
  • On the "New Document Type" screen press the "Save" button to save the Business Defined Content Type.

 

 

To add Business Defined Content to the repository:

  • Access the Documents and Media portlet.
  • From the "Documents and Media" screen press the "Add" button, then select your Business Defined Content Type.
  • From your Business Defined Content Type screen upload the business defined content and enter any appropriate values in the metadata fields.
  • Press the "Publish" button.

 

 

To view Business Defined Content:

  • Add a "Documents and Media Display" portlet to a page.
  • You should now be able to see your Business Defined Content Type in the appropriate folder(s).
